# tfrmt [![tfrmt logo](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GSK-Biostatistics/tfrmt/main/man/figures/tfrmt.png)](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/)

The tfrmt package provides a language for defining display-related
metadata, which can then be used to automate and easily update output
formats.

In clinical trials, displays are generally quite standard, but frequent,
highly specific formatting tweaks (e.g., rounding, footnotes, headers)
are very common. Prior to data analysis, study teams often generate mock
displays to represent the desired end product for sponsors to approve or
programmers to replicate. This process is typically highly manual and
separate from the programming itself. There is also a high importance
placed on verifying the accuracy of the results via a QC (Quality
Control) process such as double programming. Finally, there is a
movement toward an industry standard data structure for Analysis Results
Data “ARD”, which means analysis results datasets will have consistent
structures and column names. Specifically, the ARD is long, with 1
record per computed value. For more information about ARDs click
[here](https://pharmasug.org/download/sde/rtp2021/PharmaSUG-NCSDE_2021-08.pdf).

tfrmt supports a vision where:

- Mock displays are integrated with the programming workflow
- Results are QC’ed prior to formatting to reduce rework
- Standard formatting styles can be applied in as little as one line of
  code
- The ARD structure can be leveraged to accommodate a variety of tables

By reducing the amount of repetitive tasks, study teams can focus on the
quality and interpretation of the results themselves.

# Why tfrmt?

While there are many existing table-making packages in the R ecosystem,
they typically fall into one of two categories:

- Table packages that perform analyses and format the results
- Table packages that format and output existing data

By design, tfrmt is more of the latter, as it is intended to be used
after the results have been computed. What makes tfrmt unique, however,
is that it offers an intuitive interface for defining and layering
standard or custom formats that are often specific to clinical trials.
It also offers the novel ability to easily generate mock displays using
metadata that will be used for the actual displays. tfrmt is built on
top of the powerful gt package, which is intended to support a variety
of output formats in the future.

# Installation

The tfrmt package can be installed from CRAN with:

``` r
install.packages("tfrmt")
```

The development version of tfrmt can be installed with:

``` r
devtools::install_github("GSK-Biostatistics/tfrmt")
```

# Input data structure

We expect an input dataset that is long, with 1 record per computed
value. Required columns include:

- \[Optional\] 1 or more **group** columns, containing grouping values
- A single **label** column, containing row label values
- 1 or more **column** columns, containing column values
- A single **param** column, which provides a label for distinct types
  of values
- A single **value** column, containing the computed, raw data values
- \[Optional\] 1 or more **sorting_cols** columns, containing numeric
  values to be used in the row ordering

# Functionality

Here is an overview of what is possible with tfrmt:

- Create a “tfrmt” metadata object containing all formatting and
  labelling for the display
- Create mock displays based on existing sample data or no prior data
- ARD-standard compliant facilitates reuse and automation

Other benefits of tfrmt:

- Provides a tidyverse-friendly, pipeable interface
- Leverages gt as output engine, which allows for further customizations
  within gt itself

# More Info

For more information about how to build your own tfrmt mocks/tables
(like the one below!), please explore the
[vignettes](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/articles/examples.html).

![Example GT Demography
Table](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GSK-Biostatistics/tfrmt/main/man/figures/gt_readme.png)

Example GT Demography Table

# Package index

## Build tfrmt

- [`tfrmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/tfrmt.md)
  : Table Format
- [`body_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/body_plan.md)
  : Table Body Plan
- [`frmt_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_structure.md)
  : Format Structure Object
- [`frmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt.md)
  [`frmt_combine()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt.md)
  [`frmt_when()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt.md)
  : Table Value Formatting
- [`col_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/col_plan.md)
  [`span_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/col_plan.md)
  : Define the Column Plan & Span Structures
- [`col_style_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/col_style_plan.md)
  : Column Style Plan
- [`col_style_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/theme_element.md)
  : Column Style Structure
- [`row_grp_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/row_grp_plan.md)
  : Row Group Plan
- [`row_grp_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/row_grp_structure.md)
  : Row Group Structure Object
- [`element_block()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/element_block.md)
  : Element block
- [`element_row_grp_loc()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/element_row_grp_loc.md)
  : Element Row Group Location
- [`footnote_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/footnote_plan.md)
  : Footnote Plan
- [`footnote_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/footnote_structure.md)
  : Footnote Structure
- [`big_n_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/big_n_structure.md)
  : Big N Structure
- [`page_plan()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/page_plan.md)
  : Page Plan
- [`page_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/page_structure.md)
  : Page structure

## Layer

- [`layer_tfrmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/layer_tfrmt.md)
  : Layer tfrmt objects together
- [`update_group()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/update_group.md)
  : Remap group values in a tfrmt

## Print/Export

- [`print_mock_gt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/print_mock_gt.md)
  : Print mock table to GT
- [`print_to_gt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/print_to_gt.md)
  : Print to gt
- [`print_to_ggplot()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/print_to_ggplot.md)
  : Print to ggplot
- [`tfrmt_to_json()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/tfrmt_to_json.md)
  : Print to JSON
- [`json_to_tfrmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/json_to_tfrmt.md)
  : json to tfrmt
- [`as_json()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/as_json.md)
  : Convert tfrmt elements

## Included Templates

- [`tfrmt_n_pct()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/tfrmt_n_pct.md)
  : N Percent Template
- [`tfrmt_sigdig()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/tfrmt_sigdig.md)
  : Create tfrmt object from significant digits spec
- [`param_set()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/param_set.md)
  : Set custom parameter-level significant digits rounding

## Example Data

- [`data_ae`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/data_ae.md)
  : Adverse Events Analysis Results Data
- [`data_demog`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/data_demog.md)
  : Demography Analysis Results Data
- [`data_efficacy`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/data_efficacy.md)
  : Efficacy Analysis Results Data
- [`data_labs`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/data_labs.md)
  : Labs Analysis Results Data

## Helpers

- [`display_row_frmts()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/display_row_frmts.md)
  : Display formatting applied to each row
- [`display_val_frmts()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/display_val_frmts.md)
  : Display formatted values
- [`apply_frmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/apply_frmt.md)
  : Apply formatting
- [`cleaned_data_to_gt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/cleaned_data_to_gt.md)
  : Do all the formatting for the GT
- [`is_frmt()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_utils.md)
  [`is_frmt_combine()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_utils.md)
  [`is_frmt_when()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_utils.md)
  [`is_frmt_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_utils.md)
  [`is_row_grp_structure()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/frmt_utils.md)
  : Check if input is a frmt
- [`make_mock_data()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/make_mock_data.md)
  : Make mock data for display shells

## ARD Helpers for {cards} to {tfrmt}

- [`shuffle_card()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/shuffle_card.md)
  **\[experimental\]** :

  Shuffle `cards`

- [`prep_big_n()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/prep_big_n.md)
  **\[experimental\]** :

  Prepare `bigN` stat variables

- [`prep_combine_vars()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/prep_combine_vars.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Combine variables

- [`prep_hierarchical_fill()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/prep_hierarchical_fill.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Fill missing values in hierarchical variables

- [`prep_label()`](https://gsk-biostatistics.github.io/tfrmt/dev/reference/prep_label.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Prepare label
